thread.title: HNA cuts stake in Deutsche Bank - filing

title: HNA cuts stake in Deutsche Bank - filing
text:
April 22, 2018 / 6:21 PM / Updated an hour ago HNA cuts stake in Deutsche Bank: filing Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
BERLIN (Reuters) - Chinese conglomerate HNA has cut its stake in Deutsche Bank ( DBKGn.DE ) to 7.9 percent, according to a U.S. regulatory filing. FILE PHOTO: A HNA Group logo is seen on the building of HNA Plaza in Beijing, China February 9, 2018. REUTERS/Jason Lee/File Photo 
HNA, the aviation-to-financial services conglomerate, has been selling overseas real estate and some of its biggest financial and strategic investments following a $50 billion acquisition spree over the past two years. 
It had already reduced its stake in Deutsche Bank down to around 8.8 percent from roughly 10 percent in February. 
HNAâ€™s stake in Deutsche Bank is handled by asset manager C-Quadrat. Reporting by Victoria Bryan; editing by David Evans
